You can create an Momentum indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the Momentum constructor.

Momentum()1/2

            Momentum QuantConnect.Indicators.Momentum (
     int  period,
   )

Creates a new Momentum indicator with the specified period.

Parameters
int period The period over which to perform to computation.

Return

Momentum - The new Momentum indicator object.

Definition at line 32 of file Indicators/Momentum.cs.

Momentum()2/2

            Momentum QuantConnect.Indicators.Momentum (
     string  name,
     int     period,
   )

Creates a new Momentum indicator with the specified period.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.
int period The period over which to perform to computation.

Return

Momentum - The new Momentum indicator object.

Definition at line 42 of file Indicators/Momentum.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

private Momentum _mom;

// In Initialize()
_mom = new Momentum(name, period);
_mom.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _mom, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_mom.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _mom.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.mom = Momentum(name, period)
self.mom.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.mom, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.mom.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.mom.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with time/decimal pair. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

private Momentum _mom;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_mom = new Momentum(name, period);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _mom.Update(data[symbol].EndTime, data[symbol].High);
}
if (_mom.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _mom.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.mom = Momentum(name, period)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.mom.Update(data[self.symbol].EndTime, data[self.symbol].High)
if self.mom.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.mom.Current.Value
